Elasticity refers to the ability to dynamically scale computing resources up or down based on demand. In the case of CPU capacity, elasticity allows users to easily adjust the amount of CPU resources allocated to their applications in response to changing workloads.

With elasticity in the AWS Cloud, users can scale up their CPU capacity during periods of high demand to ensure optimal performance and responsiveness. Conversely, during periods of low demand, they can scale down the CPU capacity to eliminate underutilized resources and reduce costs.

By leveraging the elastic nature of the AWS Cloud, users can effectively eliminate underutilized CPU capacity and only pay for the resources they actually need, optimizing cost-efficiency while maintaining performance.

questions.question_text:
A company wants to use the latest technologies and wants to minimize its capital investment. Instead of upgrading on-premises infrastructure, the company wants to move to the AWS Cloud.

Which AWS Cloud benefit does this scenario describe?

choices.D: The ability to go global in minutes
choices.B: The trade of infrastructure expenses for operating expenses

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. The trade of infrastructure expenses for operating expenses

Selected Answer: B
B. The trade of infrastructure expenses for operating expenses: Moving to the AWS Cloud allows companies to avoid the upfront capital investment required to purchase and maintain on-premises infrastructure. Instead, they can leverage AWS's pay-as-you-go pricing model, where they pay for the resources and services they consume on an operational basis. This shift from a capital expenditure (CapEx) model to an operating expenditure (OpEx) model allows companies to minimize upfront costs and pay only for the resources they actually use.

"The trade of infrastructure expenses for operating expenses," which is option B.

Moving to the AWS Cloud allows the company to minimize capital investment in infrastructure and instead pay for only what they use on a pay-as-you-go basis. This model reduces up-front costs and allows companies to scale up or down as needed, making it a more cost-effective option than on-premises infrastructure. This shift from CapEx to OpEx is one of the main benefits of using cloud services like AWS

Selected Answer: B
The answer is B. The scenario describes the AWS Cloud benefit of trading infrastructure expenses for operating expenses. By using the AWS Cloud, the company can avoid the capital expense of upgrading on-premises infrastructure and instead pay only for the resources it uses in the AWS Cloud, turning a capital expense into an operating expense. This can be more cost-effective and allows the company to scale resources up and down as needed.

questions.question_text: Which AWS service can defend against DDoS attacks?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. AWS Shield Standard

B. AWS Shield Standard is a free service that is automatically included with all AWS accounts, and it provides protection against common network and transport layer DDoS attacks. AWS Firewall Manager is used to centrally configure and manage firewall rules across multiple accounts and resources, while AWS WAF (Web Application Firewall) is used to protect web applications from common web-based attacks such as SQL injection and cross-site scripting (XSS). Amazon Inspector is an automated security assessment service that helps improve the security and compliance of applications deployed on AWS.

Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B. AWS Shield Standard.

questions.question_text:
A company uses AWS Organizations. The company wants to apply security best practices from the AWS Well-Architected Framework to all of its AWS accounts.

Which AWS service will meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. AWS Control Tower

"AWS Control Tower offers a straightforward way to set up and govern an AWS multi-account environment, following prescriptive best practices. AWS Control Tower orchestrates the capabilities of several other AWS services, including AWS Organizations, AWS Service Catalog, and AWS IAM Identity Center (successor to AWS Single Sign-On), to build a landing zone in less than an hour. Resources are set up and managed on your behalf."

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/controltower/latest/userguide/what-is-control-tower.html

C. AWS Control Tower is a service that enables you to set up and govern a new, secure, and compliant multi-account environment. It provides a set of preconfigured policies and guardrails that align with the AWS Well-Architected Framework's best practices for security and compliance. By using AWS Control Tower, you can enforce these policies and guardrails across all of your AWS accounts in a consistent and scalable way.

Selected Answer: C
C. AWS Control Tower will meet these requirements. AWS Control Tower provides the easiest way to set up and govern a new, secure, multi-account AWS environment based on established best practices. With AWS Control Tower, you can apply security best practices to your AWS accounts by creating and managing a pre-configured, secure environment called a landing zone. The landing zone is a well-architected, multi-account AWS environment based on AWS best practices.

Selected Answer: B
B. AWS Config

"AWS Config is a fully managed service that provides you with resource inventory, configuration history, and configuration change notifications to use security and governance. With AWS Config, you can discover existing AWS resources, record configurations for third-party resources, export a complete inventory of your resources with all configuration details, and determine how a resource was configured at any point in time. These capabilities use compliance auditing, security analysis, resource change tracking, and troubleshooting."

https://aws.amazon.com/config/faqs/

B. AWS Config is a fully managed service that provides a detailed history of the configuration of AWS resources in an account. It can track changes and compliance of EC2 instances, as well as other AWS resources, and provides a configuration history report that can be used for auditing, compliance, and troubleshooting purposes. This feature can be used to meet the requirement of the company needing a report of modifications to its EC2 instances.

Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B. AWS Config.

AWS Config is a fully managed service that provides an inventory of your resources, configuration history, and configuration change notifications for compliance auditing and security analysis. It allows you to track changes to your AWS resources over time and makes it easy to see how a resource was configured at any point in time. In this scenario, AWS Config can provide the necessary history report about how the Amazon EC2 instances were modified last month.
